org.usefultoys.slf4j

Class Session

  • Object
    • Session

  • public final class Session
extends Object
    Profiling session for the current JVM.
    • Stores the UUID of the current SLF4J-Toys instance.
    • Retrieves global configuration.
    • Keeps the default watcher instance.
    • Keeps the default executor that periodically invokes the default watcher.

    • Property Detail

      • readMeterPrintCategory

        public static boolean readMeterPrintCategoryProperty

      • readMeterProgressPeriod

        public static long readMeterProgressPeriodProperty

    • Field Detail

      • uuid

        public static final String uuid
        UUID of the current SLF4J-Toys instance. This UUID is added to all trace messages. It allows to distinguish messages from different JVM instances when logfiles are shared. Value is assigned at application startup and cannot be changed at runtome.

      • useMemoryManagedBean

        public static boolean useMemoryManagedBean
        If memory usage status is retrieved from MemoryMXBean. Not all JVM may support or allow MemoryMXBean usage. Value is read from system property slf4jtoys.useMemoryManagedBean at application startup, defaults to false. You may assign a new value at runtime.

      • useClassLoadingManagedBean

        public static boolean useClassLoadingManagedBean
        If class loading status is retrieved from ClassLoadingMXBean. Not all JVM may support or allow ClassLoadingMXBean usage. Value is read from system property slf4jtoys.useClassLoadingManagedBean at application startup, defaults to false. You may assign a new value at runtime.

      • useCompilationManagedBean

        public static boolean useCompilationManagedBean
        If JIT compiler status is retrieved from CompilationMXBean. Not all JVM may support or allow CompilationMXBean usage. Value is read from system property slf4jtoys.useCompilationManagedBean at application startup, defaults to false. You may assign a new value at runtime.

      • useGarbageCollectionManagedBean

        public static boolean useGarbageCollectionManagedBean
        If garbage collector status is retrieved from GarbageCollectorMXBean. Not all JVM may support or allow GarbageCollectorMXBean usage. Value is read from system property slf4jtoys.useGarbageCollectionManagedBean at application startup, defaults to false. You may assign a new value at runtime.

      • usePlatformManagedBean

        public static boolean usePlatformManagedBean
        If operating system status is retrieved from OperatingSystemMXBean. Not all JVM may support or allow OperatingSystemMXBean usage. Value is read from system property slf4jtoys.usePlatformManagedBean at application startup, defaults to false. You may assign a new value at runtime.

      • DEFAULT_WATCHER

        public static final Watcher DEFAULT_WATCHER
        Watcher default instance. This Watcher is created at application startup. Its name is read from system property slf4jtoys.watcher.name, defaults to watcher. You cannot assign a new default watcher at runtime.

    • Method Detail

      • startDefaultWatcher

        public static void startDefaultWatcher()
        Starts the executor that periodically invokes the default watcher to report system status. Intended for simple arquitectures. May not be suitable for JavaEE environments that manage threads by iteself.

      • stopDefaultWatcher

        public static void stopDefaultWatcher()
        Stops the executor that periodically invokes the default watcher to report system status.

      • runDefaultReport

        public static void runDefaultReport()
        Runs the default report on the current thread. Intended for simple arquitectures. May not be suitable for JavaEE environments that do not allow blocking threads for extended amount of time.

      • getProperty

        public static String getProperty(String name,
                                 String defaultValue)
        Retrieve the value of a system propert as a string value. If the system property is not set, the default value is returned.
        Parameters:
        name - the system property name
        defaultValue - the default value, returned if system property is not set
        Returns:
        the value as string

      • getProperty

        public static boolean getProperty(String name,
                                  boolean defaultValue)
        Retrieve the value of a system propert as a boolean value. If the system property is not set, or its value is a valid number, the default value is returned. See Boolean.parseBoolean(java.lang.String).
        Parameters:
        name - the system property name
        defaultValue - the default value, returned if system property is not set
        Returns:
        the value as boolean

      • getProperty

        public static int getProperty(String name,
                              int defaultValue)
        Retrieve the value of a system propert as an integer value. If the system property is not set, or its value is a valid number, the default value is returned.
        Parameters:
        name - the system property name
        defaultValue - the default value, returned if system property is not set
        Returns:
        the value as integer

      • getProperty

        public static long getProperty(String name,
                               long defaultValue)
        Retrieve the value of a system propert as a long integer value. If the system property is not set, or its value is a valid number, the default value is returned.
        Parameters:
        name - the system property name
        defaultValue - the default value, returned if system property is not set
        Returns:
        the value as long integer

      • getMillisecondsProperty

        public static long getMillisecondsProperty(String name,
                                           long defaultValue)
        Retrieve the value of a system property as an integer representing milliseconds. If the system property is not set, or its value is a valid number, the default value is returned. The value may be suffixed with 'ms', 's', 'm' or 'h', that will be intepreted as a value in milliseconds, seconds, minutes or hours, respectively, and converted to an integer in milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        name - the system property name
        defaultValue - the default value, in milliseconds, returned if system property is not set
        Returns:
        the value in milliseconds
